Package org.example.GUI.gamestates

Class RetirerTuile

java.lang.Object
org.example.GUI.gamestates.State
org.example.GUI.gamestates.RetirerTuile
All Implemented Interfaces:
StateInterface
public class RetirerTuile extends State implements StateInterface
Represents the game state where players remove tiles from the game board. Players can select tiles adjacent to water bodies and remove them from the board.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • RetirerTuile

      public RetirerTuile(Game game)
      Constructs a new instance of RetirerTuile with the specified game. Initializes necessary classes, lists, and generates the sidebar grid. Loads images required for the game state.
      Parameters:
      game - The game instance.

    • updateTuilesPlageAdjascentToWater

      public void updateTuilesPlageAdjascentToWater()
      Updates the lists of tiles adjacent to water bodies. Checks each hexagon on the game board and adds it to the appropriate list if it is adjacent to water.

    • setIslands

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the state. This method updates the tuile effect overlay, updates the list of hexagons adjacent to water, and updates each hexagon in the list of hexagons.
      Specified by:
      update in interface StateInterface

    • generateSideBarGrid

      public void generateSideBarGrid()
      Generates the sidebar grid by creating hexagons and adding them to the sidebar list.

      public boolean PlayOrPreserve(Hexagon hex)
      Handles the action of playing or preserving a power associated with a hexagon.
      Parameters:
      hex - The hexagon containing the power.
      Returns:
      True if the power was successfully played or preserved, false otherwise.
